pullrequest.title: Disable tests compilation by default in cmake

content.raw:
Indeed, I'm working on a project using gazebo from source right now and recompiling the tests was making my compile take more than 3-4x longer so I ended up disabling the builds in the CMake to save time. As a new to compiling from source user I spent a lot of time building the tests until I noticed that 75% of the time was building tests that I am not using. 

I'd recommend not building all the tests by default as it will make life better for new users who don't know better. And the gazebo developers who need them can turn them on easily. +1 for @jlee02 's suggestion to use custom targets, though it might be worth leaving the CMake option to disable them entirely, but leave that turned on.
